result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A Hillard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey A Hillard in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Jeffrey A Hillard.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense's Bail Review Hearing held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies any modification to no contact order.  Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial Conference on 11/8/2022 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 12/5/2022 at 9:00 am.  Court will address no contact order at final pretrial.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey A Hillard appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Jeffrey A Hillard.  Attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for calendar call.  Court withdrew stayed bench warrant.  Defense requests to be heard on bail motion.  State unable to proceed on bail/bond hearing due to victim notification law.  Court scheduled a bail/bond hearing.  Court notes for the record that the defendant is compliant with JusticePoint.  Case adjourned to Branch 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-21-2022

Defendant Jeffrey A Hillard not in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Jeffrey A Hillard.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for bail/bond hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case is adjourned to Br. 41.
Calendar call scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court is in receipt of defense's motion to modify no contact order.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case scheduled for 9/2/2022 at 9:30 am, for Bail Hearing.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defense Motion to Modify Bond

Defendant Jeffrey A Hillard in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Notice of Motion To Adjourn, filed.

Defendant Jeffrey A Hillard in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court finds GOOD CAUSE to toll any time limits.  Case adjourned, Br. 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with DM (4/12/1993)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeffrey A Hillard in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Jeffrey A Hillard in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey A Hillard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2 and 3. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
